name: InterContinental Dusseldorf

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As an Ambassador I stayed past weekend for one night at the IC Dusseldorf. I had a free upgrade to the highest floor. The view you have is great to look over the city and the huge atrium of the hotel. I should have a King bed, but to my opinion it was a Queen. The lounge overlooking the atrium was great. Never in IC or Hilton such a big lounge. The breakfast and hors dóeuvres are of a very good quality. The service is really five stars. Like to mention Paulina. Also Vanessa on the front and the doorman Nebosja are very friendly in their approach. The only thing what bothered me and other guests is the rent of one of their locations to a church, who sing loud on their Sunday morning. You can imagin the effect on the atrium. But I love to come back again to this star rated hotel.
reviews.title: Intercontinental Dusseldorf - it´s five stars

reviews.text: Since IC Cologne closed I actually decided to stay in Duesseldorf despite my business being in Cologne. The hotel itself made up for the inconvenience of the travel to/from Cologne which may exemplify the standing of this hotel and my personal experience. I booked a Club room which granted access to the Club Lounge. Booked a combination of paid night and reward nights and was treated with the exact same professionalism and kindness on the reward nights as I was on the paid night.
reviews.title: People, property and location...

reviews.text: Lounge – The Club Lounge is open to three sides with a ceiling made of glass which gives you a sense of wide open spaces. Because of this and the reception area two levels down it can be a bit noisy but you still have the sensation of being in a private, exclusive area. The buffet style area has plenty of goodies for breakfast and you have the option of ordering a warm dish as well. Throughout the day you will find canapés or cakes or other sweets around the buffet area and the usual beverages. In the evening a canapé service goes way beyond the expected and there are warm samplings - buffet-style - of three different meals; vegetarian, meat and fish. The one drawback is that you cannot check in/out in said lounge. At least that is what I was told in two occasions by front desk staff before and during the stay.
reviews.title: Magnificent hotel in the hearth of the city

reviews.text: People – It seems that the staff received classes in politeness and thoughtfulness. Two examples; I commented on one type of pralines they offered in the lounge which are made from scratch in-house (and also had as a welcome display in the room).The lady from the lounge promptly surprised me with a selection of exactly that particular praline, wrapped in a nice cellophane bag, to take home. At checkout below there was a gushing of thanks for choosing to stay at the Duesseldorf IC.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Property – I was offered a very nice room (thank you IC) which offers all of the amenities you’d be used to from an IC property. Rooms very clean, shelves dusted, bed was comfortable not hard or too soft. Furniture in a classic and modern style but not tired or worn. Windows opened a bit, not fully. Minibar was replenished daily and turn-down service, although optional, was done every night. Wireless internet reception was excellent and the floor seemed very quiet and room seemed noise insulated.
reviews.title: Still Lovely

reviews.text: This was my first stay at the Intercontinental in Dusseldorf. I travel a lot through Germany and my first impressions at this hotel were good. A well appointed room with very comfortable bed. Unfortuantely, what held so much promise; disappointed so much.
reviews.title: First and Last Stay

reviews.text: Arriving late, I ordered Wiener Schnitzel to be delivered to the room. I was surprised to see a garnish of Anchovies, but the Schnitzel actually tasted like eating fish.
reviews.title: Great hotel in the city

reviews.text: I had a room on the 1st Floor at the rear of the property and whilst I'm normally not a light sleeper, the sound of the Trams going past my window all night wasn't great.
reviews.title: At the Koeningsallee, Modern & Nice

reviews.text: In the morning, I discovered the shower didn't work properly. The options were a freezing cold powerful rain shower or a warm drizzle from the handheld.
reviews.title: Nice, but not enough included

reviews.text: Final insult was the in-room iron didn't work, so I called for a replacement. 25 Minutes later, with no sign of a replacement, I gave up and checked out.
reviews.title: Enjoyed my stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for two nights and found it to be an excellent, very modern hotel. Excellent location on the Ko, where all the designer shops are and a five minute walk into the Altstadt (old town) which is why we picked it.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel - Excellent Location
Excellent house at main shopping street with great spa
reviews.text: The rooms are large and comfortable. lots of wardrobe space, english channels, air-con and large bathroom. We found the bed to be very comfortable and the whole hotel was spotless. There are no tea-making or coffee making facilities in the room.
We did not contemplate buying any drinks in the hotel or from the mini-bar as the prices were very very expensive.
reviews.title: Nice conference hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very secure hotel, you have to use your room cards to operate the lift.
reviews.title: Very comfortable, excellent service

reviews.text: The old town is great, lovely meals and some really nice bars.....bar streets are really crowded but really nice atmosphere and no idiots. Go into a Brauhaus and try the traditional ale.
reviews.title: Well designed modern hotel in the center of the Königsallee with excellent furnished rooms and friendly service.

reviews.text: The hotel is smack in the city center right on a picturesque street with a small canal. Very modern interior and good size rooms. Slow wifi is free, but you can pay for the faster speeds. Staff are friendly and the bar mixes good drinks. Breakfast buffet is until 10:30.
reviews.title: Everything you would expect at an "I"

reviews.text: I love the Intercontinental in Dusseldorf. It is very well located on Ko-Alle near all the shops and restaurants. Its maybe 10-15 mins from the airport.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Dusseldorf

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The entrance with the vaulted glass ceiling is amazing. The rooms are very well designed with good food especially the breakfast buffet. Also the Bar 59 is a great place to have an after dinner drink. The Club Lounge is also very nice and well worth it. For me there is no better place to stay in Dusseldorf. I have stayed here 3 times and have consistently been impressed.
reviews.title: Great Hotel for a weekend

reviews.text: We've stay one night at the IC Dusseldorf and enjoyed it.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel, excellent rooms

reviews.text: We booked a club room and as a ambassadormember we were upgraded to an executive king, The only question we had is whether it was a king bed, the bed was very small.
reviews.title: 5 stars

Favoured by business travellers, the hotel is only minutes from the banking quarter and Messe DÃ¼sseldorf Trade Fair Venue.
